page.title: 06A FARMER'S DAY CONT'D
page.content: to sell calves. Lunch is from twelve o'clock to one o'clock and is always a cooked meal. Although he sells calves he does not buy any as he breeds his own from his Fresian cows. He has not bought a cow since 1946. Sales representatives come to see him during the day. There is usually one a day. In the afternoon he carries on with the day's job. He comes in for tea at five o'clock. This is bread and butter, cakes and a cup of tea. Usually this is with the children. If it is hay time, harvesting or silage cutting time he goes out again after tea. Otherwise there is more paperwork and time to relax before going to bed at about eleven o'clock.
